text: Our ruler is dead, and the mantle of leadership has been passed.\\n\\nLong may he live!
#(technology.description)\\n
Joyous occasion! These family members have been blessed with a daughter.

History is full of the stories of great men wasted under the command of weak rulers. Justinian, alas, has proved himself just such a lord – his jealousy hampering Belisarius at every turn, eventually becoming a threat to his life and position. The Emperor may have been born to rule, but Belisarius was also born with a destiny. He will restore the faded glory of the Western Empire, and any impediments will be left behind. Justinian is furious at this betrayal, and overcoming him will be as much of a challenge as the conquest of Italy. Nonetheless, Belisarius embraces the task. Unleashed, he will bring the world to its knees!
Practice makes perfect. Your people's olive-growing expertise remains unmatched anywhere in the world.

Capital: #(recipient.region_and_province)\\n

The Western Roman Empire has risen in glory once more! For years it has slumbered: diluted, profaned and finally crushed by barbarian hordes. But it has lived on, sustained by the aspirations of the true Romans who sought to restore it through the ages.\\n\\nOther Emperors have tried and failed, dragged down by the weight of this task. Only the spiritual successor to the great conquerors of old, the likes of Julius Caesar, Augustus and Marcus Aurelius, could succeed in this task. Now, just such a man has risen.\\n\\nAll hail Belisarius, Lord of the Western Empire!
It is time for a new beginning. Our people have settled once more.

Capital: #(faction_2.region_and_province)\\n

The Western Empire has risen in glory once more! The Romans squandered their inheritance, assuming that glory was their birthright. But the Empire is greater than they are - it survived their fall and has waited patiently to be resurrected by a worthy people.\\n\\nWe are those people! Once we were dismissed as barbarians, but now we are truer Romans in spirit than those of pure blood. We alone have inherited their vigour and martial prowess – we alone are capable of undertaking the task of restoring their once-great Empire!\\n\\nAll hail the New Western Roman Empire!
Following a period of negotiation, this faction has agreed to become our vassal.

Our ruler has passed away, but his designated heir is too young to assume the mantle of leadership. As such, a regent has been appointed until such time when he is old enough to rule.
Our faithful subject has been wounded by the enemy. Death was beyond their power, however.

This is a time of radical religious change. Nations abandon old traditions and forge new paths almost overnight. Split religious chains allow you to exert much greater control in that area, essential if you wish to access religion-specific buildings, units, victory conditions, technologies and events.\\nHowever, these changes are not welcomed by all. Factions following new religions suffer [[col:red]]severe public order penalties[[/col]] from the presence of rival faiths. Use priests, technologies, governors and buildings to crush dissenting voices and spread your chosen religion across the land!
King’s Market is now available.
The darkness gradually abates and life returns to the earth. The crop yield is bountiful, our children are healthier and people are optimistic for a prosperous future.

This produce is at last sufficient; no longer is this province suffering from a shortage of food.

War weariness has decreased; the people and the land are finally recovering from the wars you have been waging. As the lives of the common folk return to normal and the fatigue suffered by your troops over many long campaigns is fading also.

War weariness has increased! Your people grow angry and demand an end to these incessant wars. Worse still, your troops begin to show fatigue from your long military campaigns; if your men can no longer fight then the fighting will soon come to an end, but likely not in the way you intended. You should begin the peace process; your subjects need respite from conflict - give them time to heal, and your men time to recover.
Our coffers are empty. This will have dire consequences for our people, and soon.

When the Romans landed in Africa, they tried to pay the Moors off with trinkets - a gilded silver staff and a silver crown, a white cloak, a white tunic, and a gilded boot.\\n\\nThe Moors watched as trespassers fought over their ancestral lands - biding their time, waiting for a moment of weakness.\\n\\nNow that moment has arrived, and the Moors have risen as one to reclaim their birthright. They will scour the coast like the desert wind, purging every last trace of the oppression that has befallen them for so long.
Success follows in the wake of this woman; her task was executed succesfully!
We now share a common enemy with our allies. Their possessions may now be targeted during war coordination efforts: engage in diplomacy in order to assess mutual threats and issue strategic requests.

While he was meditating on flight - a greater calamity than death itself - he decided to seek knowledge of the future through soothsayers. So, as was their custom, they examined the entrails of cattle and certain streaks in bones that had been scraped, and foretold disaster for the Huns. \\n\\n Having lost in battle, Attila's troops are demoralised and have started to doubt his powers. Surely his next defeat will be his last?

In this age of uncertainty and turmoil, there is no depth to which the power hungry, in their depravity, will stoop. The Vandals are content to merely imprison the old and infirm, but the Ostrogoths have surpassed this indignity, imprisoning their widowed queen for her pro-Roman inclinations.\\n\\nIt is a deliberately provocative action, sired by fear, defiance and ambition. The Romans are desperate to reconquer their homelands, and this may be their last chance to do so.\\n\\nAs these two mighty powers face off, others scheme, looking for ways to turn the struggle to their own advantage.\\n\\nAnd all the while, a frightened woman waits.

His holiness, the Pope has been gathered up to God, ending a fruitful chapter in Church history. A new Pope has been elected without delay; this man has a chance to guide all Christendom, few are more important or hold more sway than he does. All good Christian leaders should support the new Pope if called upon to do so, it can only be for the good of their kingdoms – but be aware, by the same token, that crossing him could have dire consequences.

The disasters which war heaps upon the head of mankind are unending. Rome’s attempts to reclaim its Empire have ravaged the continent, leaving this proud land broken and vulnerable.\\n\\nLong have the Langobards waited for such an opportunity. Now they descend, belongings on their backs and swords in hand, to claim Italy as their own. They seek no payoff, no peaceful settlement – dominion is their only aim, and they will not spare those who stand in their way.

The Roman Empire is in the rotting grasp of a plague like no other. It moves like an unseen wind, striking down families and even villages as soon as it appears, leaving a trail of blackened, suppurating corpses in its wake. Refugees spread across the globe, bringing their pestilence with them.\\nMany see it as further evidence of the much-prophesised end of days - burning wrath poured from the chalice of God’s judgement - and demand that the correct obeisance is duly paid.\\nOther, more practical minds demand alternative solutions. Dramatic improvements in sanitation and the end of trade with infected nations may stem or even stop the disease in its tracks.

History is full of the stories of great men wasted under the command of weak rulers. Justinian, alas, proved himself just such a lord – his jealousy hampering Belisarius at every turn, eventually becoming a threat to his life and position.\\n\\nThe Emperor may have been born to rule, but Belisarius was also born with a destiny. He will restore the faded glory of the Western Empire, and any impediments will be left behind.\\n\\nJustinian is furious at this betrayal, and overcoming him will be as much of a challenge as the conquest of Italy. Nonetheless, Belisarius embraces the task. Unleashed, he will bring the world to its knees!

He was indeed a lover of war, yet restrained in action, mighty in counsel, gracious to supplicants and lenient with those under his protection. \\n\\n With the death of the previous warlord, Attila seized power. Now he leads the hordes, and their armies swell in number.

The sign of a great leader is in knowing how far your people can be pushed. Wars are significant, dramatic events that should not be undertaken lightly.\\nEach turn you are at war your faction’s war weariness will increase. When it reaches a high enough level your faction will begin to receive penalties that will increase as time wears on. Additionally, losing battles will have drastic effects on war weariness depending on the severity of your defeat.\\nYou can, however, seek respite during peacetime. While at peace your war weariness will reduce quickly; furthermore, signing peace treaties will cause a large one-off reduction.\\nShould war be forced upon you, however, you may slow, halt, or even reverse war weariness levels by winning decisive battles and, as a last resort, by withdrawing your men to within your own borders to help slow its increase.\\nWars must be concluded swiftly and decisively; manage diplomacy carefully but be aware that at times of conflict the greatest enemy sometimes lies within.

The Romans have landed in Africa! In response, Gelimer, the Vandal king, has executed the old pro-Roman sovereign, Hilderic, after years of imprisonment.\\n\\nThe death of this broken old man promises to plunge the conflict into even greater depths of ferocity! There is no turning back for the Vandals now; no possibility of a peaceful resolution.\\n\\nThe rest of the world looks on with bated breath. Perhaps the Romans are no longer a force to be reckoned with – can they punish this act of brazen defiance with their trademark unflinching brutality? Or will the Vandals defeat the invaders and usher in a new era of barbarian defiance?

#(plague)

The Tanukhids are a tribe dedicated to a single purpose – rebellion. As such they may only sustain themselves through constant conquest. However, their hordes are unable to grow their own food and they may only sustain themselves by vanquishing an enemy settlement and living off its supplies for a limited number of turns.\\nAs they win battles, fame increases and new followers flock to their banner. Each victory will earn the horde significant growth for the next five turns. Additionally, by entering raiding stance they may rouse local support, earning free units every turn.\\nPersecution against Eastern Christianity led to the  first Tanukhid rebellion. When, eventually, the Tanukhids settle once more, they  will face severe public order penalties for religious differences with the local populations.\\nThe challenges facing the Tanukhids are great, but so too are their means.\\nGo forth and reduce the Roman Empire to ash!

Your conquests are countless and so your fame reaches across the world! As you survey your achievements, your thoughts turn to the Western Roman Empire - broken but not entirely forgotten.\\n\\nThere has never been a better time – or a better leader - to resurrect this fallen giant and reconquer its former territory. Act now and surpass the achievements of those who came before you! Don the robes of the Caesars of old and stride forth in Rome’s name!
